snippet: A deal reached at a United Nations meeting opens the way for satellite tracking of airliners, a breakthrough motivated by the disappearance of a Malaysia Airlines jetliner.
abstract: United Nations announces attendees of World Radiocommunication Conference have reached agreement that will allow for commercial planes to be tracked by satellite while in flight; proposal to track airliners was prompted by disappearance of Malaysia Airlines plane in 2014.
lead_paragraph: A deal reached at a United Nations meeting opens the way for satellite tracking of airliners, a breakthrough motivated by the disappearance of a Malaysia Airlines jetliner.

headline.main: U.N. Agreement Will Allow Satellite Tracking of Planes
headline.print_headline: U.N. Agreement Will Allow Satellite Tracking of Planes
